picture-set.title: Saab NG900: Shifter Housing Removal

description.p: Manual gear shifter housing removal installation on 1994-1998 Saab 900 and 1999-2002 Saab 9-3. I removed the housing to fit a short shifter.
The installation is the reverse of removal. The shifter alignment procedure must be performed after re-installation.

ul.li: 10 mm socket: centre console and shifter housing;
L-shaped 3 mm Allen key: gearbox lock.

picture-set.picture: Undo the screws and remove the footwell panel on the passenger side.
Remove the footwell panel on the driver side - two more Torx screws.
Push the climate control panel and switches out from behind. Disconnect the wires.
Release the tabs by pressing on the locking pin in the centre, and pull them out.
Remove the ash tray in the back of the console and unscrew a Torx screw in the middle.
Undo two 10 mm nuts holding the console to the floor.
Pop the window switch block, disconnect the harness and move it away.
Gently pry out the cover over the ignition lock. The 9-3 has a small circuit in it. Pop the big cover.
Undo the screws holding the console to the gearshift housing.
Pop the light switch and disconnect its wires.
List the rear half of the console, then the front half. Remove the air duct.
Insert the key and move the shifter into 4th gear.
Under the hood, pull the plug out of the gearbox locking hole and insert a long 3 mm Allen key to lock the transmission in 4th gear.
Slacken the 13 mm nut on the linkage rod and move the shifter into 3rd gear position to pull the rod out of the linkage.
Undo the four 10 mm bolts holding the housing to the floor.
Turn the housing onto its side and disconnect the ignition harness.
Remove the housing from the car.
The gearshift housing on the ground.
